data.body: Rishi Hiranyastupa Angiras's Mantra on Agni recited in Jagati Chhand meter.
प्रथमं मण्डलमं, अनु ७, ३१ सूक्तम् ऋषि: हरिण्यस्तुप आन्गिरासः छन्द: जगती अग्निः देव
त्वमग्ने प्रथमो अङगिरस्तमः कविर्देवानां परि भूषसि व्रतम । विभुर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय मेधिरो द्विमाता शयुः कतिधा चिदायवे ॥
tvam agne prathamah anghirah-a-tamah kavih devanam pari bhusas vratam; vi-a-bhuh visvasmai bhuvanaya medhirah dvi-a-mata sayuh katidha cit ayave.

O Agni, the first (1), excellent among the Angirasa-s (2). Seer, you adorn the deeds of the gods from all sides (3). You manifest in multiple ways for the world (4); you are wise; how you measure the two worlds (5). In how many ways do you dwell in man? (6).

tvam agne (you agni) prathamah (first) anghirah-a-tamah (angira) kavih devanam (kavi - seer; deva - deity) pari (around) bhusas vratam (decorating with gems); vi-a-bhuh visvasmai (vibhu - of fire, vishvas - instil with confidence) bhuvanaya (earth, man, abode) medhirah (essence) dvi-a-mata (dvi - two, mata - measure) sayuh (dwell) katidha (how often?) cit ayave (shout)

The last line of the verse indicates that the modes of manifestation of Agni in humans are as many as human beings. *mata*: measurer derived from ma, to measure, the same root as in the word maya. *dvi*: two, always stands for the two worlds, Heaven and Earth. Agni establishes in the aspirant a vast knowledge of the dual form of Heaven and Earth. *shayu*: dwell (in man)
